attributes.action: to join with us to demand that the Banks and mortgage lenders pass on the recent Bank of England interest rate cuts to ordinary home owners, businesses and working people in full.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: If the United Kingdom is to get through the downturn all of us must accept our fair share of the pain.  Citizens, business, the Third Sector, local and national Government and, most definitely, the banks.  We are your depositors, your customers, your shareholders; we pay your fees in the good times and as taxpayers we bail you out in the bad times.  We have a right to expect that you act in good faith, that you share the pain of recession in an equitable way.  Banks have an economic, political and above all moral duty to the families of this great country to cut their rates in line with of Bank of England. As this nation attempts to navigate the worry and stress of a recession, to do otherwise will be an act of unpatriotic and shameful self interest.
